channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Chess body investigating ex-world champion who accused Daniel Naroditsky of cheating
item.description: U.S. chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky died this week at age 29. Former world champion Vladimir Kramnik had accused Naroditsky, among others, of cheating in the sport.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky died this week at age 29. Former world champion Vladimir Kramnik had accused Naroditsky, among others, of cheating in the sport.

(Image credit: Antony Jones)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: 'A slap in the face': Ranchers feel betrayed by Trump's plan to buy Argentine beef
item.description: Over the past few days, cattle ranchers and agricultural groups have been sounding the alarm that a plan to import more foreign beef would hurt struggling ranchers.
item.content:encoded:
Over the past few days, cattle ranchers and agricultural groups have been sounding the alarm that a plan to import more foreign beef would hurt struggling ranchers.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 'Why does my toddler … ?' Your kiddo's most confounding behavior, decoded
item.description: Why does my toddler say "no" to everything? Say everything is "mine"? Want to crash into everything? Child development experts unpack common toddler behaviors and offer advice on how parents can cope.
item.content:encoded: Why does my toddler say "no" to everything? Say everything is "mine"? Want to crash into everything? Child development experts unpack common toddler behaviors and offer advice on how parents can cope.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Effort to pay at least some federal workers fails in Senate
item.description: The Senate failed to advance two partisan bills that would have paid some federal workers during the shutdown. Democrats and Republicans remain deadlocked as the shutdown drags on.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate failed to advance two partisan bills that would have paid some federal workers during the shutdown. Democrats and Republicans remain deadlocked as the shutdown drags on.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: How presidents have changed the White House — and how Trump's ballroom is different
item.description: President Trump is demolishing the East Wing to make room for a ballroom. His administration says he's continuing a presidential legacy of White House renovations, but this is the biggest in decades.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is demolishing the East Wing to make room for a ballroom. His administration says he's continuing a presidential legacy of White House renovations, but this is the biggest in decades.

(Image credit: File)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Trump plows ahead with East Wing demolition despite calls for caution
item.description: President Trump is plowing ahead with plans to build a grand ballroom where the East Wing of the White House currently stands. The plans have not gone through the committee tasked with overseeing such projects.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is plowing ahead with plans to build a grand ballroom where the East Wing of the White House currently stands. The plans have not gone through the committee tasked with overseeing such projects.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: NBA coach Chauncey Billups, player Terry Rozier arrested in FBI gambling probe
item.description: Prosecutors say Rozier and others passed confidential intel to organized crime groups to help wager on NBA games. Billups allegedly participated in a separate scheme involving underground poker games.
item.content:encoded:
Prosecutors say Rozier and others passed confidential intel to organized crime groups to help wager on NBA games. Billups allegedly participated in a separate scheme involving underground poker games.

(Image credit: Carmen Mandato)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: It's the deadliest year for people in ICE custody in decades; next year could be worse
item.description: There have been at least 20 deaths in ICE custody in 2025, the deadliest year since 2004. As the agency is ramping up hiring and increasing detentions, concerns remain about how to stop the trend.
item.content:encoded:
There have been at least 20 deaths in ICE custody in 2025, the deadliest year since 2004. As the agency is ramping up hiring and increasing detentions, concerns remain about how to stop the trend.

(Image credit: Dominic Gwinn)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Vance slams Israel's parliament vote on West Bank annexation, calling it an 'insult'
item.description: Vice President Vance's scathing remark came as he wrapped up an Israel trip, as the Trump administration attempts to keep up momentum on the U.S.-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Vance's scathing remark came as he wrapped up an Israel trip, as the Trump administration attempts to keep up momentum on the U.S.-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.

(Image credit: Nathan Howard)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Court to rule on troop deployment. And, a new Pentagon press corps emerges
item.description: A court could rule on legal challenges surrounding the National Guard deployments in the coming days. And, a new policy for Pentagon reporters has led many to turn in their press passes.
item.content:encoded:
A court could rule on legal challenges surrounding the National Guard deployments in the coming days. And, a new policy for Pentagon reporters has led many to turn in their press passes.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
